text: As Mock Trial Championships Begin, Rothman Renews Call to Allow Students of All
label: BODY

text: Faiths to Compete
label: BODY

text: For Immediate Release: May 12, 2006
label: BODY

text: Contact: Kimberly Allen, (202) 226-8364; (202) 420-1524 [cell]
label: BODY

text: As Mock Trial Championships Begin, Rothman Renews Call to Allow Students of All Faiths to Compete
label: BODY

text: Congressional letter sent as 2006 competition begins without accommodations for religious students.
label: BODY

text: (Washington, DC)— On Thursday, Congressman Steve Rothman (D-NJ) led a bipartisan group of U.S.
label: BODY

text: Representatives in calling on the Board of Directors of the National High School Mock Trial Championships to allow
label: BODY

text: students of all faiths to participate in this annual competition without violating the practices of their religion. The 2006
label: BODY

text: championship round began yesterday morning in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma. This is the first competition that has
label: BODY

text: occurred since the Board voted in October 2005 not to make any future accommodations for students who observe the
label: BODY

text: Sabbath on Friday and/or Saturday.
label: BODY

text: "It is not our intent that the conference should be rescheduled or even restructured in a significant way. Rather, we are
label: BODY

text: looking for a statement of understanding from you that demonstrates a willingness to allow students of all faiths to
label: BODY

text: compete without violating the practices of their religion," wrote Rothman and 15 other lawmakers who co-signed the letter
label: BODY

text: to the Mock Trial Board of Directors. "The competition's schedule… negatively affects an increasing number of
label: BODY

text: students from various religious backgrounds in the United States, including Christians, Jews, and Muslims who observe
label: BODY

text: the Sabbath on Friday or Saturday."
label: BODY

text: Last year, satisfactory accommodations were made by the Board to allow students from the Torah Academy of Teaneck,
label: BODY

text: New Jersey to compete without violating their religious practices. The matches involving Torah Academy, which is an
label: BODY

text: orthodox Jewish school, were scheduled in such a manner that all participants were able to compete in the
label: BODY

text: championships without inconveniencing any of the other student groups or disrupting the competition as a whole.
label: BODY

text: However, this year the Board has refused to make such accommodations again, which has prompted two state teams to
label: BODY

text: withdraw in protest, including one from New Jersey and one from North Carolina, and start their own alternative mock
label: BODY

text: trial competition that does make accommodations for religious students.
label: BODY

text: In the letter, Rothman reminded the Board of his Congressional Resolution (H.Res.600), which calls on the Board to
label: BODY

text: accommodate the religious beliefs of all students participating in the competition. The bill has 53 bi-partisan co-sponsors
label: BODY

text: and has the support of Democratic Leadership in the House of Representatives.
label: BODY

text: "It is our hope that the Board will revisit its decision to refuse any future accommodations for students who observe the
label: BODY

text: Sabbath on Friday and/or Saturday and instead, make all allowances in this and future competitions that enables all
label: BODY

text: eligible students to participate, regardless of their religion," the lawmakers wrote.
label: BODY

text: A full copy of the letter and legislation is available online at: http://rothman.house.gov/pdf/mocktrial.pdf .
label: BODY
